p.i: The House met at half-past Two o'clock
The following Members took and subscribed the Oath, or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by Law:

speech.p: I suspend the sitting till half-past Three.

p.i: The following Members took and subscribed the Oaths or made and subscribed the Affirmation required by Law:

ul.li: Right honourable Christopher John Chataway, Chichester.
Robert John Maxwell-Hyslop, esquire, Tiverton.
Thomas Russell Fairgrieve, esquire, West Aberdeenshire.
Right honourable John Thomson Stonehouse, Walsall, North.
Right honourable Sir Geoffrey Stanley de Freitas, KCMG, Kettering.
John Jakob Mendelson, esquire, Penistone.
Kenneth Robin Warren, esquire, Hastings.

speech.p: It is my intention to suspend tomorrow's morning sitting until 2.15 p.m. This will enable any right hon. or hon. Members who have not yet been sworn in to do so before the debate begins on the Queen's Speech. I hope that they will take, the, opportunity because I understand that 50 to 60 right hon. and hon. Members have yet to be sworn in.
Resolved, That this House do now adjourn.—[Mr. Harper.]

p.i: Adjourned accordingly at twenty-five minutes to Four o'clock.
